{{Infobox criminal | name = Evangelos 'Ange' Goussis | image_name = Goussis.jpg | image_caption = |nationality = Australian | birth_date = {{Birth date and age|df=yes|1967|9|14}}[http://www.theage.com.au/national/the-hard-fall-of-goussis-the-contender-20080712-3e74.html The hard fall of Goussis the contender] [[The Age]], 13 July 2008 | birth_place = [[Tashkent]], [[Uzbek Soviet Socialist Republic]], [[Soviet Union|USSR]] | death_date = | death_place = | alias = Ange | charge = | conviction = [[Drug trafficking]] (1989)
[[Attempted murder]] (1989)
[[Murder]] (2006)
Murder (2008)
Intentionally causing serious injury | conviction_penalty = Life imprisonment Non-parole period of 33 years | conviction_status = Imprisoned | occupation = [[Boxing|Boxer]], [[Kickboxer]], [[Bouncer (doorman)|Bouncer]] | Achievements = former kickboxing World Champion | spouse = | parents = Aristides Goussis,
Mahi Goussis | children = }} '''Evangelos Goussis''', (born 14 September 1967) is an Australian former boxer and kickboxer from [[Geelong, Victoria]], and is a multiple murderer, guilty of the murders of two victims of the [[Melbourne gangland killings]].[http://www.smh.com.au/news/national/moran-murderer-revealed-as-twotime-killer/2008/05/29/1211654221548.html Moran murderer revealed as two-time killer] [[Sydney Morning Herald]], 30 May 2008 He is of [[Greeks|Greek]] ethnicity. Goussis is currently detained in the maximum security Acacia unit of [[Barwon Prison]] where he is employed as a lawn mower. He is also a former WKA [[Kickboxing]] World champion. ==Early life== Goussis was born in [[Tashkent]], in the former [[Uzbek Soviet Socialist Republic]], of the [[Soviet Union|USSR]] to a family of [[Greeks in Uzbekistan|Greek immigrants in Uzbekistan]]. Ange Goussis' father, Aristides Goussis, had been a resistance fighter against the [[Nazi]]s during World War II for [[Greece]], and was a pro-Soviet guerilla in the brutal [[Greek Civil War]] of the late [[1940s]]. In 1949, following the Right-Wing's victory against the communist guerillas in [[Greece]], Aristides and his wife, Mahi, a [[Red Cross]] child-care worker, fled to [[Uzbek Soviet Socialist Republic|Uzbekistan]].{{Citation needed|date=October 2008}} Ange Goussis arrived in [[Australia]] at the age of 8. After leaving school, Goussis held various jobs such as an [[Apprenticeship|apprentice]] [[Auto mechanic|motor mechanic]], a [[sheet metal]] worker, fitness consultant and nightclub [[Bouncer (doorman)|bouncer]]. In November 1989, Goussis was convicted of attempted murder and [[drug trafficking|trafficking]] in [[heroin]] and sentenced to a term of imprisonment.[http://www.austlii.edu.au/cgi-bin/sinodisp/au/cases/vic/VSC/2006/168.html R v Goussis (2006) VSC 168], [[Supreme Court of Victoria]], 3 May 2006 During his early twenties, Goussis drifted into a life of crime after meeting many criminal associates via his employment as a bouncer and via boxing. In March, 2004 Goussis was convicted of carrying an unregistered firearm. ==Boxing and kickboxing career== As a boxer, Goussis won the inaugural [[Lionel Rose]] Shield. By 1987 he was a contender for the [[1988 Summer Olympics]] to be held in [[Seoul]] however did not qualify. In the early 90's, Goussis competed in kickboxing. Goussis became a world kickboxing champion, winning the (WKA) [[World Kickboxing Association]] middleweight title. Evangelos Goussis' name stands alongside many other [[Greeks|Greek]] [[kickboxing]] greats such as former world champions, [[Stan Longinidis|Stan 'The Man' Longinidis]] and [[Tosca Petridis]], [[Louie Iosifidis|Louie 'The Ice' Iosifidis]], and current world champion [[Mike Zambidis|'Iron' Mike Zambidis]] and others.{{Citation needed|date=October 2008}} Ange Goussis went eventually back to [[boxing]] however, training with Keith Ellis. He had three professional fights, TKO-ing Shane Wirth in 39 seconds in March 1995 and drawing with Ricky Jackson two weeks later. In October 1997, at Bondi, he stopped Adam Turner in the first round. ==Melbourne gangland killings== {{Main|Melbourne gangland killings}} ===Murder of Lewis Caine=== {{main|Lewis Caine}} Lewis Caine (also known as Sean Vincent) was an underworld figure based in Melbourne, Victoria, and one time boyfriend of lawyer [[Zarah Garde-Wilson]]. Caine had lived with Garde-Wilson for a period of approximately two years before his death. On 8 May 2004 Goussis and associate Keith Faure travelled to Melbourne from [[Geelong, Victoria|Geelong]] to meet with Caine in a [[Carlton, Victoria|Carlton]] hotel at the invitation of Faure. The body of Caine was found with a single gunshot wound to his head in a dead-end [[Brunswick, Victoria|Brunswick]] street on 8 May 2004. At his trial for the murder of Caine, Goussis claimed self defence, stating Caine produced a gun and fired at him however the gun jammed. Goussis stated he then shot Caine to the head with a single shot before dumping his body in the laneway. Goussis was found guilty by a jury for the murder of Lewis Caine. ===Murder of Lewis Moran=== {{Main|Lewis Moran}} Masked gunmen entered the Brunswick Club on [[Sydney Road, Melbourne|Sydney Road]], [[Brunswick, Victoria|Brunswick]] at approximately 6.40pm on 31 March 2004. Moran ran from his place at the bar and through a poker machine room before the gunman caught up with him and shot him twice, the fatal bullet being fired into the back of his head from a few centimetres away. Associate Bertie Wrout was severely wounded but survived the attack. On 29 May 2008, Goussis was found guilty of the murder of Lewis Moran and on February 9, 2009, was sentenced to life imprisonment with a minimum 30 years non-parole period.{{cite news | first=AAP report | last= | coauthors= |authorlink= | title=Underworld kingpin's killer jailed for life | date=2009-02-09 | publisher= | url =http://www.smh.com.au/news/national/underworld-kingpins-killer-jailed-for-life/2009/02/09/1234027910517.html | work =The Sydney Morning Herald | pages = | accessdate = 2009-02-09 | language = }} ==Murder of Shane Chartres-Abbott== Goussis is under investigation for the 2003 murder of [[Male prostitution|male prostitute]] Shane Chartres-Abbott who was shot dead in a professional hit outside his [[Reservoir, Victoria|Reservoir]] home on 4 June 2003 as he was travelling to the Melbourne [[County Court of Victoria|County Court]] where he was due to appear to face Rape charges.[http://www.theage.com.au/national/gunman-was-the-key-to-underworld-killings-20080529-2jjl.html Gunman was the key to underworld killings] In 2010 the underworldassain admitted to shoot dead abbot, and has linked to corrupt cops to the murder. [[The Age]], 30 May 2008 ==References== {{reflist|2}} {{Melbourne gangland killings}} {{Persondata | NAME = Goussis, Evangelos | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = | DATE OF BIRTH = 14 September 1967 | PLACE OF BIRTH = [[Tashkent]], [[Uzbek Soviet Socialist Republic]], [[Soviet Union|USSR]] | DATE OF DEATH = | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Goussis, Evangelos}} [[Category:1967 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Australian boxers]] [[Category:Australian drug traffickers]] [[Category:Australian kickboxers]] [[Category:Australian people of Greek descent]] [[Category:Australian people of Uzbekistani descent]] [[Category:Australian people convicted of murder]] [[Category:Contract killers]] [[Category:Greek boxers]] [[Category:Greek kickboxers]] [[Category:Melbourne gangland killings]] [[Category:Middleweight boxers]] [[Category:Middleweight kickboxers]] [[Category:People from Geelong]] [[Category:People from Tashkent]] [[Category:Security guards]] [[Category:Australian prisoners sentenced to life imprisonment]] [[Category:Prisoners sentenced to life imprisonment by Victoria (Australia)]] [[Category:People convicted of murder by Victoria (Australia)]]
